CatDescriptText: Mrs. Azielee Peebles, hotel cook, 1158 Oetting St., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "Yes. If two persons are separated, they are not going to stay that way, and therefore I believe that they should divorce before they being running around."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Azielee Peebles wearing light colored coat, holding dark handbag, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
